# TaskFlow Manager - Update Summary

## New Features Implemented

### 1. Future Task Scheduling
Users can now schedule tasks for any future date, not just today.

**Changes:**
- Added date picker in the Add Task dialog
- Quick shortcuts: Today, Tomorrow, +1 Week buttons
- Manual date entry with validation
- Tasks appear on their scheduled date automatically

### 2. Recurring Tasks
Users can create tasks that automatically repeat on a schedule.

**Recurrence Patterns Supported:**
- **Daily**: Task repeats every day
- **Weekly**: Task repeats on selected days of the week (Mon-Sun)
- **Monthly**: Task repeats on the same day number each month

**Features:**
- Optional end date for recurring tasks
- Automatic generation of task instances up to 90 days ahead
- Each instance can be completed independently
- Recurring instances regenerate each time app starts

### 3. Future Tasks Viewer
New window to view all upcoming tasks.

**Features:**
- View next 7, 30, or 90 days
- Color-coded by priority and status
- Sorted by date
- Shows both one-time and recurring task instances

## Database Schema Changes

The `tasks` table now includes these additional columns:

```sql
is_recurring INTEGER DEFAULT 0
recurrence_pattern TEXT
recurrence_days TEXT
recurrence_end_date TEXT
parent_task_id INTEGER
```

**Note:** Existing databases will be automatically migrated when the app runs.

---

## How Recurring Tasks Work

1. **User creates recurring task:**
   - Fills in title, description, priority
   - Checks "Make this a recurring task"
   - Selects pattern and options
   - Clicks Save

2. **System creates parent task:**
   - Saves task with `is_recurring = 1`
   - Stores recurrence pattern and settings

3. **System generates instances:**
   - Creates individual task instances up to 90 days ahead
   - Each instance has `parent_task_id` pointing to parent
   - Instances have `is_recurring = 0`

4. **User interacts with instances:**
   - Each instance appears on its scheduled date
   - Can be marked done independently
   - Shows in daily view and future tasks view

5. **System maintains instances:**
   - On app startup, regenerates instances
   - Avoids duplicates by checking existing instances
   - Extends instances as dates approach

---

## Key Design Decisions

### Why Generate Instances in Advance?
- Simpler UI logic (show tasks as regular tasks)
- Easy to edit individual instances
- Better performance (no complex recurrence calculation on every view)
- User can see future schedule clearly

### Why 90 Days?
- Balances database size with planning horizon
- Most users plan 1-3 months ahead
- Can be easily modified in code if needed

### Why Not Support More Complex Patterns?
- Keeps UI simple and user-friendly
- Covers 90% of common use cases
- Can be extended in future versions

### Why Separate Parent and Instances?
- Parent task stores the recurrence rule
- Instances are independent tasks
- Allows editing instances without affecting pattern
- Makes it easy to stop recurrence (delete parent)
